comments.content: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1.java -jar build/compiler.jar --compilation_level=ADVANCED_OPTIMIZATIONS --js a.js 2. 3. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? window.ActiveXObject&&alert("GOOD"); What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? window.a&&alert("GOOD"); Please provide any additional information below. function test() { if (window.ActiveXObject) { alert("GOOD"); } } test();
i hope Window.prototype.ActiveXObject should be add to externs
I agree with @leei, if window.ActiveXObject exists on IE browsers, it need to be added on externs.
ActiveXObject is in the externs, it just isn't defined as a property on window.
This issue was closed by revision r1058.
